thread.title: Judge Blocks Texas From Cutting Planned Parenthood From Medicaid
thread.title_full: Judge Blocks Texas From Cutting Planned Parenthood From Medicaid

author: Scott Kelnhofer
title: Judge Blocks Texas From Cutting Planned Parenthood From Medicaid
text:
Judge Blocks Texas From Cutting Planned Parenthood From Medicaid "... flies in the face of basic human decency." by Scott Kelnhofer February 22, 2017 at 3:37pm Share on Facebook 536 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
A federal judge has blocked plans by state officials in Texas from eliminating Planned Parenthood as a Medicaid health care provider. 
U.S. District Judge Sam Sparks issued a preliminary injunction Tuesday, saying the state was taking its actions in an effort to punish Planned Parenthood based on undercover videos shot by Project Veritas in 2015 that showed some Planned Parenthood officials talking about the sale of body parts from aborted fetuses. 
Sparks said Texas can’t cut off Planned Parenthood as a Medicaid provider based on what the judge described as “unsubstantiated and indeterminate allegations” found in the videos. Advertisement - story continues below Ex Manager: Planned Parenthood ‘Treated Women Like Cattle’ 
“A secretly recorded video, fake names, a grand jury indictment, congressional investigations — these are the building blocks of a best-selling novel rather than a case concerning the interplay of federal and state authority through the Medicaid program,” Sparks wrote. “Yet, rather than a villain plotting to take over the world, the subject of this case is the State of Texas’s efforts to expel a group of health care providers from a social health care program for families and individuals with limited resources.” 
“Such action would deprive Medicaid patients of their statutory right to obtain health care from their chosen qualified provider,” he added. 
Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton said the state will appeal the ruling. Advertisement – story continues below 
“Today’s decision is disappointing and flies in the face of basic human decency,” Paxton said in a statement. “Even the remains of the most vicious criminals are treated with respect. But the children who never had a chance at life become so-called medical waste or, alternatively, a commodity to be bartered for.” 
Texas kicked Planned Parenthood out of its Medicaid program Dec. 20, saying the Project Veritas videos were proof of misconduct by the organization for violating state and federal laws regarding abortions. Planned Parenthood sued to block the cut, and Sparks ordered a hearing for mid-January. Tuesday’s ruling was the result of testimony heard in that hearing. 
In his ruling Tuesday, Sparks said the state had failed to produce evidence that Planned Parenthood had broken federal or state laws, Medicaid provisions, or even medical or ethical standards. Advertisement - story continues below
